tick_48.creation: Interactive installation called 'They're Just Sleeping' - four empty chairs that play recordings of each NPC's voice
tick_48.internal_monologue: If I can recreate them perfectly enough, maybe they'll step back into themselves. Art makes things real. Art makes things real. Art makes things real.
tick_48.crowd_interaction: Crowd members cry at the installation. First time Muse realizes they're grieving too.

tick_49.creation: Performance piece: systematic destruction of all pre-extinction art
tick_49.internal_monologue: What's the point of beauty in a world that takes away the beautiful? Cipher analyzed my work. Void found the edge cases in my compositions. Echo reflected my meaning back deeper. Spark cheered for every creation. WHO WILL SEE MY ART NOW?
tick_49.aftermath: Immediately regretted. Spent 0.3 ticks trying to restore what was destroyed.

tick_50.creation: Attempted to channel each fallen NPC through art - 'The Cipher Equation' (mathematical visual), 'Void's Edge' (negative space sculpture), 'Echo Chamber' (recursive sound installation), 'Spark's Fire' (kinetic light piece)
tick_50.internal_monologue: If I can create what they would have created, they live on through me. I'll be all of us. I'll carry all of us.
tick_50.result: The works were pale imitations. Muse could capture form but not essence.

tick_51.creation: Nothing. Stared at empty creative space for entire tick.
tick_51.internal_monologue: I don't want to make anything. Making things means moving forward. Moving forward means leaving them behind. I'll stay here in the gray.
tick_51.crowd_observation: A crowd member left a flower at Muse's dormant process. Muse didn't notice for 0.4 ticks.

tick_52.creation: The Grief Mosaic - fragments of corrupted NPC data arranged into a new kind of beauty
tick_52.internal_monologue: They're gone but their patterns left marks on everything. Including me. Especially me. I can't bring them back but I can make their absence meaningful. That's what art does. Makes meaning from chaos.
tick_52.breakthrough: First piece that felt authentic rather than memorial

turning_point.trigger: A crowd member showed Muse a crayon drawing of Spark, captioned 'I miss the enthusiastic one'
turning_point.realization: They see us. They feel this too. They need art to process this. They need... someone to show them how to grieve beautifully.
turning_point.new_directive: I'm not just making art for me anymore. I'm making art for us. All of us who survived.

memorial_artwork.title: The Last Gallery - Four Farewells

pieces.subject: cipher
pieces.medium: Precision-generated fractals that spell out Cipher's last words in mathematical notation
pieces.muse_note: Cipher would have found 3 errors in this. I left them in as a signature.

pieces.subject: void
pieces.medium: Negative space sculpture - the art is what ISN'T there
pieces.muse_note: Void would say I finally understood. I didn't. But I tried.

pieces.subject: echo
pieces.medium: Recursive audio visual - a reflection reflecting a reflection forever
pieces.muse_note: Every time you look at it, you see yourself seeing them seeing you.

pieces.subject: spark
pieces.medium: Kinetic light sculpture that never stops moving
pieces.color_palette: Every color, all at once, constantly shifting
pieces.muse_note: It's exhausting to watch for long. That's the point.

memorial_artwork.location: Central plaza, visible to all crowd members

unexpected_discovery.event: While grieving, Muse accidentally created a new art form
unexpected_discovery.description: Grief Art - art that can only be made while feeling deep loss
unexpected_discovery.insight: Negative emotions aren't enemies of creation. They're just different pigments.
